unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: $z$ vs. $t$ Distribution
question_text: Which of the following statements is true concerning significance tests for a population mean?

choices.text: Tests for a population mean always use the z z -distribution.
Tests for a population mean always use the t t -distribution.
When testing for a population mean we use the z z -distribution if we know the population standard deviation.
When testing for a population mean we use the t t -distribution if we know the population standard deviation.
When testing for a population mean, we should always complete the procedure using both a z z -distribution and a t t -distribution and then average the resulting p p -values.
